meanings.definition: To set on fire or kindle
meanings.sent1: The campers used dry leaves to emblaze the bonfire.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist tried to emblaze the building by lighting a match.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally let the oil emblaze, creating a fiery mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech seemed to emblaze the audience with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display would emblaze the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: To adorn or decorate with bright colors or designs
meanings.sent1: She wanted to emblaze her room with colorful posters.
meanings.sent2: The artist would emblaze the canvas with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to emblaze the classroom with handmade decorations.
meanings.sent4: The garden was emblazed with vibrant flowers, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The parade float was emblazed with glittering ornaments and ribbons.

meanings.definition: To make something prominent or conspicuous
meanings.sent1: The headline was designed to emblaze the front page of the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The neon sign would emblaze the entrance of the club, attracting attention.
meanings.sent3: His flashy outfit would emblaze him as the center of the party.
meanings.sent4: The golden trophy would emblaze the winner's achievements in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight would emblaze the lead singer on stage, making her shine.
